revised_title: SRY Gene Expression and its Role in Gonadal Differentiation
tldr: The author discusses the role of the Y-linked gene SRY in determining sex in mammals. SRY acts during a critical period of gonadal differentiation to divert the normal pathway of gene activity towards testes development. The author explains how SRY expression is crucial for testis determination and how it interacts with other genes to regulate cellular phenotype. The article also highlights the importance of cell-cell interactions in the developing gonad for successful testis differentiation.
